A day to bring together the designers and developers of the future of the web.

On Wednesday 9th April, back-to-back with JSConf AU, the historic Melbourne Arts House will be filled with international and local experts, tasty food, great coffee, and plenty to talk about.

Melbourne Arts House, 1874

It will be a special one-track, one-day conference following on from the fantastic CSSConf US and CSSConf EU events. There’ll also be some fun activities around the conference day, allowing you to see parts of wonderful Melbourne and hang out with some new friends.

Tickets go on sale early 2014 and will be strictly limited.

Ticket availability will be announced via our mailing list and the @cssconfau Twitter account. Sign up below to ensure you don’t miss out:

A number of student and scholarship tickets will be available to those who need them.

Team

The core organising group is @benschwarz, @mobywhale, @xzyfer, @glenmaddern and @toolmantim. We’ve run community events all around Australia including JSConf, RubyConf, SydCSS and Rails Camp.

Sponsorship

We’re looking for fantastic companies to help make this event possible. If you think your company could help, please drop an email to sponsors@THISDOMAIN.

Talk Proposals

There’ll be a number of slots open for talk proposals. We’ll announce shortly what the submission and selection process will be.

Spread the word

If you know someone that you’d like to be at the first CSSConf Australia, either to speak or just to hang out with, then let them know. If you don’t know anyone in particular, ask your Twitter peeps! Let’s try to get as many great people together as we can.

Code of Conduct

CSSConf Australia strives to be an inclusive, safe, accessible and fun event for everyone involved. It’s an important condition of participation that all organisers, sponsors and attendees follow the Conference Code of Conduct at the conference and related events.

Get in touch

You can contact us on Twitter at @cssconfau and by email at team@THISDOMAIN.
